Expectation1: Communicate with clients and vendors regarding financial matters.
Situation1: A client has an inquiry about a specific line item on their most recent invoice.
Expectation2: Live according to Christian moral values and ethics
Situation2: They encounter choices where Christian ethics become more relevant
Story: As an accountant, I’m used to fielding questions from clients, but today’s inquiry from Mr. Lee unsettled me. He wanted clarification on a line item that, according to the records, was billed for services never actually rendered. My supervisor had told me to assure clients that all charges were accurate, and to avoid raising unnecessary concerns. But as a Christian, honesty is non-negotiable. I could feel the weight of my faith pressing on my conscience, urging me to be truthful, even if it meant going against my supervisor’s instructions. My hands trembled as I dialed Mr. Lee’s number, torn between my professional obligation to follow company protocol and my deeper commitment to integrity. The phone rang, and I hesitated, caught in the tension between my role as a diligent employee and my calling to live out my faith.
